description.narrative:
Oxfam program ID PROG10130
As a country programme we are cognisant of the fact that even if we have worked on gender equality programmes from different angles before the Norms approach is a relatively new approach in which we need to learn and deepenour thinking as we proceed. In its early phases the programme will therefore include a research work to learn what approaches have worked elsewhere in other countries or in other programmes locally.
Considering the role of family level elders, traditional leaders and schools in shaping attitudes towards women, CSO led advocacy for changed perceptions will target these institutions and engage men and boys in the process. The programme also seeks to bring a different understanding around unpaid care work at the family and community level as it has a bearing on women reaching their full potential.
Role models will be identified to inspire girls and families while institutions will be assisted to develop a greater understanding and application of the legal framework within which they are required to function in enhancing changes for women.
Oxfam in Mozambique will also participate in the Global organisational campaigns promoting Women#s rights.
